p: The lignans are fiber-associated compounds found in plants, particularly seeds, nuts, grains, and vegetables. Lignans are rare in the Lagochilus genus, with only three lignans named erythro-1-[(4-O-β-D-glucopyranosyl-3-methoxyl)- phenyl]-2-[(5’-methoxyl)-pinoresinol]-propane-1,3-diol ( 132), tortoside C ( 133), and sisymbrifolin ( 134) isolated from L. ilicifolius [ 7] ( Table 3, Figure S8). Another three lignans: 1-(4-hydroxy-3-methoxy)-phenyl-2-[4-(1, 2, 3-trihydroxypropyl)-2-methoxy]-phenoxy- 1, 3-propandiol ( 135), (+)-isolarisiresinol 3-α-O-β-D-glucopyranoside ( 136), and (-)-isolarisiresinol 3-α-O-β-D-glucopyranoside ( 137) were isolated from whole herb of L. platyacanthus [ 58]. From L. ilicifolius (+)-syringaresinol ( 138) was identified by Qian et al. [ 7].
